articles.title: Astronomers find evidence suggesting that our solar system has nine planets again - Earth.com
articles.description: Astronomers find evidence of a possible ninth planet beyond Neptune, reigniting the debate about the formation of the Solar System.
articles.content: Our solar system once had nine planets, but things changed when Pluto lost its planetary status in 2006. Ever since, astronomers worldwide have hunted for signs that we might still have a ninth plane… [+4651 chars]

articles.author: Jennifer Ouellette
articles.title: Falcon 9 sonic booms can feel more like seismic waves - Ars Technica
articles.description: Trajectories, wind shear, temperature gradients, topography, and weather can affect how a sonic boom spreads.

articles.title: Ancient human fingerprint suggests Neanderthals made art - BBC
articles.description: A Neanderthal man is believed to have painted a nose on a pebble using red pigment more than 43,000 years ago.
articles.content:
The pebble on the left, before it was excavated, and on the right after being unearthed.

articles.title: Singularities in Space-Time Prove Hard to Kill - Quanta Magazine
articles.description: Black hole and Big Bang singularities break our best theory of gravity. A trilogy of theorems hints that physicists must go to the ends of space and time to find a fix.
articles.content: Two blind spots torture physicists: the birth of the universe and the center of a black hole. The former may feel like a moment in time and the latter a point in space, but in both cases the normally… [+16205 chars]
